awd_titl_txt: Electrical Engineering Design Projects to Support           Research Conducted at the National Solar Observatory
awd_abstract_narration: In a cooperative effort between the National Solar Observatory at               Sunspot, New Mexico, and the University of Texas at El Paso (UTEP),             junior and senior electrical and computer engineering students                  spend the summers working on design projects at UTEP and at the                 observatory.  At present, observatory personnel do not have the                 time or resources to retrofit or redesign existing equipment that,              although marginal, functions at an acceptable level.  This opens                the door for many student design projects aimed at optimizing                   existing equipment.  These projects include the design of a seeing              monitor for observing solar phenomena and a CCD camera interface.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers
